lol, Valve and Squad have a lot in common. Most of Valve's titles are buyouts from fans. They buy the rights, hire the crew, and let them do their thing. DOTA, Portal, and Left 4 Dead are all the result of that type of action (I think Half-Life might be too, unsure). Squad has done the same thing, most recently Spaceplane+ but other times in the past as well.

Half-Life is all Valve, which actually was a Quake mod. Valve is all about turning mods into full-fledged games, as all the ones you listed have mods at their roots. Left4Dead started as a CounterStrike mod for concept, then was built up from scratch with the Source engine to the game we know today.

That's today's fun fact.

Squad is quite awesome, indeed. They start a little program for model rocketry, and then they go and let it explode into the game we have today. I doubt Harvester and his original gang even imagined it would become this when they first sat down and started it. I always enjoy reading Harv's blogs, as they do lighten my day, and the gang is always so faithful in keeping us informed on what's been going on, even if it was who won the last thumb war in the office the other day. Really makes me feel part of it all.

Thank you, Squad, for what is possibly one the greatest games of all time.

Overwhelmingly positive reviews (especially on Steam), excellent community, excellent game.

But most of all, thank you for F5 and F9

Thank you, Squad, for listening to your community in the recent Engine performance boost controversy! Obviously not everyone will like every feature in the final game, but I appreciate your willingness to pull a controversial feature. My respect has gone up even more for you guys!

Thread revival - because it deserves it.

Yes, thank you indeed! This game is very addictive and just the kind of challenge I enjoy most. Best of all, the developers have been very modern and proactive by involving themselves in the community.

I have seen some games succeed by a great margin and others avoid a fatal fallout by listening to the community. It's easier and more popular than ever to do so, thanks for taking the time!

This seems to be the proper place to put this. Just read the devnotes for yesterday and I am very happy. The whole barn thing was the first time I'd ever disagreed with a move the devs had made, and to see that mine and others concerns have been acknowledged is amazing. It seems like ya'll are striving to meet a good compromise despite the hours of work it will add. You guys are truly the best dev team I've ever had the pleasure to buy from; and you set a great example for how early access should be. So thank you KSP Development Team, for your hard work and for being so close to the community.
